News Sentai Filmworks Screens Revue Starlight Anime Film in June With Early May Premiere at Anime Central   posted on 2022-04-22 02:41 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Anime screens in N. America on June 5-6    Sentai Filmworks announced on Thursday that it will screen Revue Starlight The Movie, the new anime film for the Shōjo Kageki Revue Starlight franchise, in North American theaters in June following an early premiere at the Anime Central convention in Rosemont, Illinois on May 20 at 8:00 p.m. The movie will screen in select theaters on June 5 with an encore presentation on June 6. The company streamed an English-subtitled trailer:      Sentai Filmworks describes the story:   Revue Starlight The Movie picks up soon after the series left off and opens the curtain a new, original story set during Karen Aijo and Hikari Kagura's third year at Seisho Music Academy, a performing arts school for young women who aspire to the heights of on-stage stardom. In the next chapter of their theatrical lives, these young women will face one another on the battlefield of the stage, where song, dance and thrilling swordplay collide to illustrate the rich emotional narratives of the film's protagonists.  The film was previously slated to open in Japan in May 2021, but was delayed to June 2021 due to the state of the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19) and the resulting temporary closure of some theaters.    The Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight Rondo Rondo Rondo compilation film opened in August 2020. The film was first slated to open in May 2020, but was postponed due to the spread of COVID-19. The new film continues the story of the compilation film.    Bushiroad announced the franchise in April 2017 with a stage musical and television anime project. The musical Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight The LIVE, billed as a  "2.5 dimension musical and live concert," ran in Tokyo in September 2017. The 12-episode television anime series premiered in July 2018. Sentai Filmworks streamed the series on HIDIVE with English subtitles and an English dub. The franchise also inspired a new mini anime titled Shōjo☆Konto All Starlight (Girl Comedy Skit All Starlight), which premiered in July 2019.    Sora Goto and Kanata Nakamura launched Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight Overture, the first manga for the franchise, in Kadokawa's Dengeki G's Comic magazine in January 2018, and ended it in October 2018. The franchise also includes the Butai Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight ―The LIVE― SHOW MUST GO ON and Yonkoma Starlight manga.    Ateam's Revue Starlight Re LIVE smartphone game launched worldwide in April 2019. A third stage musical production was slated for July 2020, but was delayed to July 2021 due to COVID-19. News Sentai Filmworks Screens Revue Starlight Anime Film in June With Early May Premiere at Anime Central   posted on 2022-04-22 02:41 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Anime screens in N. America on June 5-6    Sentai Filmworks announced on Thursday that it will screen Revue Starlight The Movie, the new anime film for the Shōjo Kageki Revue Starlight franchise, in North American theaters in June following an early premiere at the Anime Central convention in Rosemont, Illinois on May 20 at 8:00 p.m. The movie will screen in select theaters on June 5 with an encore presentation on June 6. The company streamed an English-subtitled trailer:      Sentai Filmworks describes the story:   Revue Starlight The Movie picks up soon after the series left off and opens the curtain a new, original story set during Karen Aijo and Hikari Kagura's third year at Seisho Music Academy, a performing arts school for young women who aspire to the heights of on-stage stardom. In the next chapter of their theatrical lives, these young women will face one another on the battlefield of the stage, where song, dance and thrilling swordplay collide to illustrate the rich emotional narratives of the film's protagonists.  The film was previously slated to open in Japan in May 2021, but was delayed to June 2021 due to the state of the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19) and the resulting temporary closure of some theaters.    The Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight Rondo Rondo Rondo compilation film opened in August 2020. The film was first slated to open in May 2020, but was postponed due to the spread of COVID-19. The new film continues the story of the compilation film.    Bushiroad announced the franchise in April 2017 with a stage musical and television anime project. The musical Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight The LIVE, billed as a  "2.5 dimension musical and live concert," ran in Tokyo in September 2017. The 12-episode television anime series premiered in July 2018. Sentai Filmworks streamed the series on HIDIVE with English subtitles and an English dub. The franchise also inspired a new mini anime titled Shōjo☆Konto All Starlight (Girl Comedy Skit All Starlight), which premiered in July 2019.    Sora Goto and Kanata Nakamura launched Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight Overture, the first manga for the franchise, in Kadokawa's Dengeki G's Comic magazine in January 2018, and ended it in October 2018. The franchise also includes the Butai Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight ―The LIVE― SHOW MUST GO ON and Yonkoma Starlight manga.    Ateam's Revue Starlight Re LIVE smartphone game launched worldwide in April 2019. A third stage musical production was slated for July 2020, but was delayed to July 2021 due to COVID-19. News Sentai Filmworks Screens Revue Starlight Anime Film in June With Early May Premiere at Anime Central   posted on 2022-04-22 02:41 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Anime screens in N. America on June 5-6    Sentai Filmworks announced on Thursday that it will screen Revue Starlight The Movie, the new anime film for the Shōjo Kageki Revue Starlight franchise, in North American theaters in June following an early premiere at the Anime Central convention in Rosemont, Illinois on May 20 at 8:00 p.m. The movie will screen in select theaters on June 5 with an encore presentation on June 6. The company streamed an English-subtitled trailer:      Sentai Filmworks describes the story:   Revue Starlight The Movie picks up soon after the series left off and opens the curtain a new, original story set during Karen Aijo and Hikari Kagura's third year at Seisho Music Academy, a performing arts school for young women who aspire to the heights of on-stage stardom. In the next chapter of their theatrical lives, these young women will face one another on the battlefield of the stage, where song, dance and thrilling swordplay collide to illustrate the rich emotional narratives of the film's protagonists.  The film was previously slated to open in Japan in May 2021, but was delayed to June 2021 due to the state of the new coronavirus disease (COVID-19) and the resulting temporary closure of some theaters.    The Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight Rondo Rondo Rondo compilation film opened in August 2020. The film was first slated to open in May 2020, but was postponed due to the spread of COVID-19. The new film continues the story of the compilation film.    Bushiroad announced the franchise in April 2017 with a stage musical and television anime project. The musical Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight The LIVE, billed as a  "2.5 dimension musical and live concert," ran in Tokyo in September 2017. The 12-episode television anime series premiered in July 2018. Sentai Filmworks streamed the series on HIDIVE with English subtitles and an English dub. The franchise also inspired a new mini anime titled Shōjo☆Konto All Starlight (Girl Comedy Skit All Starlight), which premiered in July 2019.    Sora Goto and Kanata Nakamura launched Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight Overture, the first manga for the franchise, in Kadokawa's Dengeki G's Comic magazine in January 2018, and ended it in October 2018. The franchise also includes the Butai Shōjo☆Kageki Revue Starlight ―The LIVE― SHOW MUST GO ON and Yonkoma Starlight manga.    Ateam's Revue Starlight Re LIVE smartphone game launched worldwide in April 2019. A third stage musical production was slated for July 2020, but was delayed to July 2021 due to COVID-19.    Source: Sentai Filmworks        discuss this in the forum (11 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

Data: feature          23 comments       Why Girls und Panzer Works So Well   Apr 20, 21:00 23 comments                 anime    Who would've thought that a series about high school girls in short skirts fighting tank battles would be the peak of military-themed anime? ― CGDCT, or “Cute Girls Doing Cute Things,” is a genre in anime that usually revolves around a high school setting where cute girls in school uniforms talk about love, discuss fashion, go shopping, share a hobby, and do other things without a single guy in sight...

Forum - View topicNEWS: Yuu Watase's Arata: The Legend Manga Moves Online in May             Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MagicPolly    Joined: 26 Nov 2020 		    Posts: 820       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 3:53 am            I hope she's able to properly take care of her health, moving to online is probably the best choice in that case      Back to top                  SailorPluto1313    Joined: 26 Jan 2016 		    Posts: 115       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 4:49 am            Happy to hear the author can work at her own pace and focus pn her health instead of suffering just to meet deadlines. I am a huge fan of this series and can't wait to see what happens next, but the most important thing is the author's health - mental and physical.   It is so disheartening to hear that many mangakas suffer from health issues due to meeting insane deadlines and that it seems to just be a normal thing.   As a manga fan, i would rather wait longer for a work to come out if it meant the authors could prioritze their health.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3963       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 3:33 pm            I hope this is the best solution for Watase to continue her work while still maintaining her health. It is so disheartening to hear that many mangakas suffer from health issues due to meeting insane deadlines and that it seems to just be a normal thing.   As a manga fan, i would rather wait longer for a work to come out if it meant the authors could prioritze their health.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3963       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 3:33 pm            I hope this is the best solution for Watase to continue her work while still maintaining her health. Data: feature          23 comments       Why Girls und Panzer Works So Well   Apr 20, 21:00 23 comments                 anime    Who would've thought that a series about high school girls in short skirts fighting tank battles would be the peak of military-themed anime? ― CGDCT, or “Cute Girls Doing Cute Things,” is a genre in anime that usually revolves around a high school setting where cute girls in school uniforms talk about love, discuss fashion, go shopping, share a hobby, and do other things without a single guy in sight...

News Galaxy Express 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey Manga Enters Final Arc   posted on 2022-04-21 06:00 UTC-8 by Rafael Antonio Pineda         Yuzuru Shimazaki's retelling of Leiji Matsumoto's original manga launched in 2018    The June issue of Akita Shoten's Champion RED magazine revealed on Tuesday that Yuzuru Shimazaki's Ginga Tetsudo 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey (Galaxy Express 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey) manga is entering its final arc.    In addition, the magazine revealed that the manga will skip the next issue on May 19, and will return in the August issue in June.    The manga retells the story of Leiji Matsumoto's Galaxy Express 999 original manga. The story of the anime and manga follows a young orphan named Tetsuro as he travels with a mysterious woman named Maetel through the galaxy on a space train, in the hopes of obtaining a cybernetic body. The train stops at many planets along the way, often leading to adventures for the two.    Shimazaki launched the manga in Champion RED in March 2018. Matsumoto is credited with the original work, setting, and design for the manga, and Shimazaki is drawing the new series. Akita Shoten published the manga's seventh compiled book volume in September 2021.    Shimazaki previously drew a reboot manga of Matsumoto's Gun Frontier manga.    The 113-episode television anime series aired from 1978-1981. An anime film alternate retelling premiered in 1979. The franchise then spawned multiple other movies, specials, and OVAs. The original 18-volume manga ran from 1977-1981. News Galaxy Express 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey Manga Enters Final Arc   posted on 2022-04-21 06:00 UTC-8 by Rafael Antonio Pineda         Yuzuru Shimazaki's retelling of Leiji Matsumoto's original manga launched in 2018    The June issue of Akita Shoten's Champion RED magazine revealed on Tuesday that Yuzuru Shimazaki's Ginga Tetsudo 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey (Galaxy Express 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey) manga is entering its final arc.    In addition, the magazine revealed that the manga will skip the next issue on May 19, and will return in the August issue in June.    The manga retells the story of Leiji Matsumoto's Galaxy Express 999 original manga. The story of the anime and manga follows a young orphan named Tetsuro as he travels with a mysterious woman named Maetel through the galaxy on a space train, in the hopes of obtaining a cybernetic body. The train stops at many planets along the way, often leading to adventures for the two.    Shimazaki launched the manga in Champion RED in March 2018. Matsumoto is credited with the original work, setting, and design for the manga, and Shimazaki is drawing the new series. Akita Shoten published the manga's seventh compiled book volume in September 2021.    Shimazaki previously drew a reboot manga of Matsumoto's Gun Frontier manga.    The 113-episode television anime series aired from 1978-1981. An anime film alternate retelling premiered in 1979. The franchise then spawned multiple other movies, specials, and OVAs. The original 18-volume manga ran from 1977-1981. News Galaxy Express 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey Manga Enters Final Arc   posted on 2022-04-21 06:00 UTC-8 by Rafael Antonio Pineda         Yuzuru Shimazaki's retelling of Leiji Matsumoto's original manga launched in 2018    The June issue of Akita Shoten's Champion RED magazine revealed on Tuesday that Yuzuru Shimazaki's Ginga Tetsudo 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey (Galaxy Express 999 Another Story: Ultimate Journey) manga is entering its final arc.    In addition, the magazine revealed that the manga will skip the next issue on May 19, and will return in the August issue in June.    The manga retells the story of Leiji Matsumoto's Galaxy Express 999 original manga. The story of the anime and manga follows a young orphan named Tetsuro as he travels with a mysterious woman named Maetel through the galaxy on a space train, in the hopes of obtaining a cybernetic body. The train stops at many planets along the way, often leading to adventures for the two.    Shimazaki launched the manga in Champion RED in March 2018. Matsumoto is credited with the original work, setting, and design for the manga, and Shimazaki is drawing the new series. Akita Shoten published the manga's seventh compiled book volume in September 2021.    Shimazaki previously drew a reboot manga of Matsumoto's Gun Frontier manga.    The 113-episode television anime series aired from 1978-1981. An anime film alternate retelling premiered in 1979. The franchise then spawned multiple other movies, specials, and OVAs. The original 18-volume manga ran from 1977-1981. Apr  6, 00:30 2 comments                 anime    We've reached the end of the road (almost, again)! Mikasa and Eren reflect back on the path of destruction. Back to top                  Ryuji-Dono    Joined: 26 Apr 2018 		    Posts: 833       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 5:39 pm              MFrontier wrote:    Hey, some LA VA's in the AMAIM dub!            Well, it was outsourced to NYAV Post after all.      Back to top                  AceLuffy4Ever    Joined: 30 Aug 2015 		    Posts: 295       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 6:03 pm            Why is everything getting a premiere except for Rise of the Shield hero Dub      Back to top                  RommieSG    Joined: 10 Feb 2004 		    Posts: 80 		    Location: Hokuei High School 		        Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 6:28 pm              AceLuffy4Ever wrote:    Why is everything getting a premiere except for Rise of the Shield hero Dub           I'm still waiting on the dub announcement for PuraOre! Pride of Orange, so we'll just have to be patient.      Back to top                   KitKat1721    Joined: 03 Feb 2015 		    Posts: 715       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 6:34 pm              MFrontier wrote:    Hey, some LA VA's in the AMAIM dub!           Backlog dub (started airing Fall 2021) that was out-sourced to NYAV Post, so unfortunately not much of a change regarding what CR intends to do in-studio.   I will say I do typically love NYAV Post as a studio (even though the director is super new to directing solo), but man it feels like CR/Funi always gives them the short end of the stick when it comes to projects compared to Sound Cadence or even Kocha. The majority of shows they get usually seem very average at best       Back to top                  Sevokevo Royuki    Joined: 15 Jul 2012 		    Posts: 182 		    Location: Texas 		        Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 8:53 pm              AceLuffy4Ever wrote:    Why is everything getting a premiere except for Rise of the Shield hero Dub            Season 2 was confirmed to get the dub.. so be patient… that’s all we can do…      Back to top                   loveliver    Joined: 26 Nov 2014 		    Posts: 121       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 9:48 pm              AceLuffy4Ever wrote:    Why is everything getting a premiere except for Rise of the Shield hero Dub            Season 1 was done at Bang Zoom! and Season 2 will be done there too. Just that there’s going Bang Zoom’s way (taking their time to start for the most part).      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3963       Posted: Fri Apr 22, 2022 11:26 pm              loveliver wrote:       AceLuffy4Ever wrote:    Why is everything getting a premiere except for Rise of the Shield hero Dub            Season 1 was done at Bang Zoom! and Season 2 will be done there too. Just that there’s going Bang Zoom’s way (taking their time to start for the most part).           Apparently Billy Kametz is also not feeling well (he canceled a convention appearance and the Tokyo 24th Ward dub has been delayed), so that might delay the dubs for Shield Hero season 2 and Science Fell in Love season 2 (although I would think he would have recorded the last two episodes of 86 by now).      Back to top                  Beatdigga    Joined: 26 Oct 2003 		    Posts: 3671 		    Location: New York 		        Posted: Sat Apr 23, 2022 10:20 am            Well that sucks.  Hopefully Mr. Kametz gets better soon.      Back to top                  iamthevastuniverse    Joined: 11 Nov 2010 		    Posts: 996       Posted: Sat Apr 23, 2022 5:33 pm            I can't say I'm digging the list of actors/actresses listed here thank god my backlog of dub titles to watch is a decent size plenty to watch without embracing this dud of a dubbing season.
